Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Alrighty, time for the update! So, I am wrapping some stuff up, to make sure everything good in the legal department with a privately held entity (games, intellectual property, yada yada). I made a massively big boillerplate that allows me to whip out games fast and easy. Meanwhile in the batcave today, UX and UI wizards are thinking about the arcade hall and every fancy buttons. As you all know already, that crazy stuff is already named and baptized with Komodore64. I set up a blank Twitter account, @komodoregames don't expect much interaction at this point, but slowly towards the end of this week, things will become more "tangible".

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Also, I got a green role as ecosystem developer; looks like I have mild super powers. My coffee tastes better suddenly, which could be just the sugar.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Last update for this morning; I managed to setup a streamer setup; microphone, camcorder, HDMI capturing, etc., which makes it possible to create a lab design the streaming process of the games as we go. Since Twitch, YouTube and others probably have heavily moderation and are overcrowded, I was thinking about to roll our own. I also read somewhere two smart peoples invented the flux capacitator that allows streaming over the blockchain with Komodo, so that's pretty awesome.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: A lot of people asked me about my business plan. My plan is simple, far from elegant and no fact sheet.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 1. Build team of best and brightest

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 2. Gather resources.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 3. Build stuff.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 4. Deploy stuff.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 5. Buy big chair made out of swords

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: 6. Freedom (Aretha Franklin meets Braveheart meets Captain Janeway)

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Time to rock and roll.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: If Komodore64 arcade is going to be a website, do you have any thoughts on what type of wallet you will use? preferably not hot wallets, for liability purposes, maybe see if we can integrate Magnum or Guarda browser extension wallets? @PTYX any idea on this?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: But likely need a custom wallet (maybe similar style as magnum/guarda, where keys are stored locally) but supports the various blockgames or gamechains coins and assets or w.e.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I don't know the current state of development, but there is agama-web that runs through browser but everything is stored in users computer
https://github.com/pbca26/agama-web
https://www.atomicexplorer.com/wallet/

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: If we can use Agama it could be more flexible as a proof of concept and then later that can be integrated into fancier guis. Although Agama would be a hotwallet unless the user uses a cold storage address as a watch-only

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I was thinking it would be more like Metamask. You access it just to make main transactions in crypto. The blockgame assets would still need their own wallet, the Komodore wallet

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Now, regarding all the "details" around Komodore64, remember, we barely started all this fuzz up, I actually don't have a desk yet at The Hague Tech, but progress comes in small details. So, I rather disclose details about the what, how and why's when we are off the drawing table; I can't spend the day discussing details, so I try to give a daily update about things we are doing.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Like today, we gave out cake and spread happiness. Because happiness is awesome.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Secondly, @Meyse came with a horrible idea for a horrible gameplay that became something awesome. Now, we figured out the streaming part, we are talking with The Hague Tech about a streaming studio, had a brief meeting with a talented photographer who loves streaming technology and basically just as crazy, a phone call with an experienced PR/Event Manager in gaming, who also happens to be an ace in marketing.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Also, a poster was stuck on my front door with a super nintendo controller saying "Sleep, Eat, Repeat", we were partially dancing and not to forget, a really awesome talk to secure some financial stuff. I also had horrible chinese food in our local china town, talking with a high up municipality dude talking about shaping the future. Oh, I forced three people to install Chameleon.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: I could've made a video, but I am currently in my underwear.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Yes, too much information, but I want you, the reader, to know how dedicated I am to bring you the update.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Just finished up a new part of 6AME, which is now an integral part of the Unity SDK

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: When you create logic in 6AME, its stored as an Unity asset, which makes them really easy to migrate from Unity versions. I am currently working to make its editing way more user friendly; however its runtime is still very, very beta.
